intro: Eleocharis triangularis, commonly known as the triangular sedge, is a flowering plant species native to wetland environments in the Americas. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its triangular stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. It produces small, clustered spikelets that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Eleocharis triangularis often thrives in marshy or seasonally flooded areas, contributing to the ecological diversity of wetland habitats.
